Failed login attempts specifically targe.Action: Filter Zeek logs (conn.log, ssh.log, rdp.log, http.log) and Windows Event ID 4625 for failed authentication attempts targeting known external-facing service ports/protocols (e.g., RDP 3389, SSH 22, common VPN ports, specific web server ports). Group failures by target IP/port and source IP. Identify source IPs with high failure rates against these specific external services compared to baseline. Use correlation analysis between Zeek logs showing connection attempts and Event ID 4625 showing failures on the target system.

Successful logins immediately preceded b.Action: Correlate successful logon events (Windows Event ID 4624) with preceding failed logon events (Windows Event ID 4625) from the same source IP and targeting the same user account within a defined time window (e.g., 1-5 minutes). Use descriptive statistics or percentile analysis on historical data to establish a threshold for the number of failed attempts preceding a successful logon. Flag successful logons that occur after a count of failed attempts exceeding this statistical threshold (e.g., 95th percentile).
